body:
Note there is a subtle difference between the font size of the MathJax rendering in Markdown cells and latex output. I have tracked this down to how MathJax dynamically sizes its rendered math to match the surrounding HTML. In the case of a Markdown cell, the Math is wrapped in a `

` tag. This tag is missing in the latex output. We could add it, but I am not sure we want to do this - that is a horrible way of trying to get MathJax to size things as we want and probably won't be very reliable.
Is simply wrapping the output in a p tag actually sufficient? Have you tried it?  The difference in size is pretty big.

I haven't tried putting the `

` tag into the DOM in the latex output area. But I tested what would happen if I put the `

` tag and latex in an html output area. MathJax reduced the size of the rendered equation - but not the full amount. MathJax wraps its rendered HTML in a div and sets the font size in a `style` attribute based on some complex calculations it does. Here were the sizes it is picking: - Math in `

` tag in a Markdown cell = 104%. - Math in latex output area with no `

` tag = 120% (that is the big one you are seeing) - Math in `

` tag in HTML output area = 112% (my test) Summary - the way it computes the size is not as simple as looking to see if it is in a `

` tag. I can try the put the `

` tag in the latex output area to see if that fixes it. Do you think that makes sense or is all of this just too dicey?

Here are some screenshots of the current centering approach:

![screen shot 2013-09-19 at 9 20 51 am](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/27600/1174448/b2ed2ff6-2147-11e3-8d0a-017bf3cf1e77.png)

![screen shot 2013-09-19 at 9 21 48 am](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/27600/1174446/aeb16114-2147-11e3-8558-4b280d3b9aaf.png)

![screen shot 2013-09-19 at 9 21 37 am](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/27600/1174445/abd420da-2147-11e3-9801-587e3ac56d29.png)
I see that you did the mathjax centering with CSS, rather than MathJax config. Is there a reason for this?

Yes I tried that first.  When you use MathJax config to center equations, it centers all of them - includes those in output areas, which we said that we didn't want.  The CSS approach is required to only center the ones in Markdown cells.

- [ ] Review needed
- [ ] Fix vertical space/margins on images/tables in Markdown cells
I've been playing with it, and I like this better.   I put this in my custom.js as soon as we talked about it last week, and I think it's been an improvement.
I'm pinging a few engineers/mathematicians for review.
Visually this looks really good to me.  Thanks for this @ellisonbg
+1 for adopting this!

I have added a uniform 1em spacing above and below tables.  This matches the spacing between paragraphs and images as well:

![screen shot 2013-09-20 at 2 18 17 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/27600/1183959/69a9ab50-223a-11e3-922f-e6aeefa2a90b.png)
That seems like a reasonable value - since it's the same as the paragraph spacing, do you want to use a less variable for it?
Ok I think this is ready to go.
Opps rebasing now...

I will have a look to see if I can find a better way of setting this - it
might not be possible given how MathJax is setting it.

On Sat, Sep 21, 2013 at 12:51 PM, Damián Avila notifications@github.comwrote:

> Some people are using ipython.min.css to give IPython style to their
> blogs... if we use
> 
> ```
> .MathJax_Display {
>     text-align: center !important;
> }
> ```
> 
> with the !important, we force people to hack this css to change the
> center property...
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/ipython/ipython/pull/4154#issuecomment-24869444
> .

## 

Brian E. Granger
Cal Poly State University, San Luis Obispo
bgranger@calpoly.edu and ellisonbg@gmail.com
@damianavila we have to used `!important` here as MathJax sets `text-align` on the element itself. The only reliable CSS that can override that is `!important`.
This should be ready for merge now.
If we have to use `!important`, perhaps it makes the most sense for that to be in a file included only in style.css and not ipython.css.

But then our markdown equations will be left justified in the nbconvert'ed
output?

On Mon, Sep 23, 2013 at 3:18 PM, Min RK notifications@github.com wrote:

> If we have to use !important, perhaps it makes the most sense for that to
> be in a file included only in style.css and not ipython.css.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/ipython/ipython/pull/4154#issuecomment-24960101
> .

## 

Brian E. Granger
Cal Poly State University, San Luis Obispo
bgranger@calpoly.edu and ellisonbg@gmail.com

> But then our markdown equations will be left justified in the nbconvert'ed output?

only if:
1. it uses the embedded HTML, not full HTML output
2. the surrounding context configures MathJax to left-justify (i.e. preferences are respected)

Have you looked at centering MathJax in general via MJ config? Since it only affects display, not inline, it wouldn't actually center most single-line math output. I wonder if that would look wonky - the implementation would certainly be cleaner.

Yes, I did play with the MathJax config on this.  It just sets `text-align` on the `MathJax_Display` `div` tag using a style attribute.  It is all or nothing for all MathJax elements on the page. The only way to change individual elements is to use `!important`.
When I check out this branch, equations are not actually centered. I checked the CSS, and the text-align is indeed applied, but that does not center equations.

I agree with @minrk that we can make `!important` only in the `style.min.css` and not in the `ipython.min.css`...

IPython.nbconvert uses `style.min.css` in the CSSHTMLHeader, not the `ipython.min.css`... so I do not see any problems in only make `!important` inside `style.min.css`.

Thoughts?
I can also get the MathJax text-align CSS assigned to the div without using `!important`, but just like with `!important`, it doesn't actually have any effect.

I am greatly confused.  I just double checked the behavior of this branch and I see, in both FF and Chrome:
- Centered equations, tables and images in markdown cells
- Left justified equations in code cell output

Can you test on different browsers, clear your cache, etc?

OK I have a slightly different approach:
- Set center justify for everything in MathJax config and `.rendered_html`.
- Override with left justify in `.output_area`.
- `!important` is still required because MathJax styles using `element.style`.
@ellisonbg working perfect here... and thanks to avoid including the `!important` inside `ipython.min.css` ;-*

@minrk given the current state of the branch, if we remove the `!important` CSS statement from `ipython.min.css`, static HTML will have centered equations in output areas.  That means users of nbconvert will be forced to figure out for themselves that the `!important` line is needed.  This is one case where I would rather err on the side of having it work right for most people rather than customization just in case someone wants to have centered equations in output.  The equation alignment in markdown cells will be whatever is set in the MathJax config.
